thread.title: Leicester City legend Gary Lineker has Twitter spat with former Ukip leader Nigel Farage over Brexit fish protest - Leicester Mercury

author: Katrina Chilver
title: Leicester City legend Gary Lineker has Twitter spat with former Ukip leader Nigel Farage over Brexit fish protest - Leicester Mercury
text:
Leicester City legend Gary Lineker has Twitter spat with former Ukip leader Nigel Farage over Brexit fish protest Farage was dropping dead fish into the Thames Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Leicester City legend Gary Lineker has had a Twitter spat with ex-UKIP leader Nigel Farage over a Brexit protest. 
Yesterday, Farage and other protesters threw dead fish into the Thames outside Parliament in opposition to the Brexit transition deal. 
The stunt was to show that the fishing industry is unhappy that the UK will not regain control of the country's fishing waters when Brexit kicks in next year. 
Sharing a picture of Farage dropping a dead fish into the river, remain supporter Lineker tweeted: "Rarely have two such slimey, smelly, slippery creatures held on to some fish." 
The scathing tweet did not go unnoticced by Farage, who replied and said: "Gary thinks it's funny that an entire British industry has been devastated. He is in the same category as Bob Geldof." 
Refusing to let the argument end, adding the hashtag #hakenews, Lineker said: "No, I think you're funny. Funny how you pretend to care about the industry yet during the three years that you were a member of the European Parliament Fisheries Committee, you attended one out of 42 meetings." poll loading How would you vote if a Brexit referendum was held now? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
